tg.t: if only it was like that
in the shelter of a dense forest or wood
away from, i.e.: lee (of an island)
towards the south or in a southerly direction
it happens once in a while
an expression meaning it's a long time coming.
on each side of the water
on both sides of the river or lake
on each side there are mountains
exclamation of big surprise, e.g.: Oh my God, you're not kidding (quest.) That is terrible.
a little bit lower or below
an expression meaning, it is dangerous and must be handled carefully.
it is dark purple in color, i.e.: mauve
an expression meaning there are puddles everywhere, i.e.: it is puddly.
long time ago, once upon a time
a very, very long time ago
an expression meaning for sure or I assure you.
an expression meaning better now than later or might as well do it now.
an expression meaning it happened unintentionally
a slang word for someone who is unable to talk
a slang word for someone who is unable to talk
an expression meaning Spring is starting.
an expression indicating items are being rotated
an expression of annoyance meaning it happened again.
an expression of annoyance meaning here it is again.
an exclamation of surprise, it is astonishing or surprising or amazing.
an expression meaning that happens by chance.
the start or beginning of next month
an expression meaning way in front
before or ere. (Plains). Var. pâmayes. Alt. namic (Northern)
among a crowd of people. Var. mekwânohk
right now, at this time, as of now
in the middle of the current
in the middle of or among people
in the middle of the forest
many, in great quantity. (Plains). Alt. okistakewi (Northern)
an expression meaning it is juicy, i.e.: succulent.
a statement used when handing something over to someone, here.
an expression indicating being lined up or being lined up in a row.
nothing or none. (Plains). Alt. namoya kîkway (Northern)
before or ere. (Northern). Alt. mayes, pâmayes (Plains)
no. Also a negative mark for not
there is no legal equivalent in Cree for the terms of not guilty or guilty. For a plea of not guilty, a speaker would use the above expression to indicate I am not responsible or I did not do it.
an expression used to indicate an earthquake or tremor and means îthe ground trembles. î (Northern). Alt. nanamaskipiyiw (Plains)
an expression used to indicate an earthquake or tremor and means îthe ground trembles. î (Plains). Alt. nanamahcipayiw (Northern)
all in pieces. In all directions
an expression meaning why now after all the damage done (quest.)
being far out in the water
the tree is fully leafed out
in two places or two directions
an expression indicating a total reversal of plans
there is no legal equivalent in Cree for the terms of guilty or not guilty. For a plea of guilty, a speaker would use the above expression to indicate I am responsible for doing it.
in a little while. Var. nomanakes
too many or an excessive amount
used to specify direction, this way.
off to the side of the road, i.e.: wayside
clarity is hampered by an obstacle
an expression meaning îit is the same one î or îit is the same to me. î
towards the south or in a southerly direction. (Northern). Var. âpihtâkisikanohk (Northern)
along the side, i.e.: lake shore
an exclamation of surprise or disappointment, i.e.: wow, how about that (excl.) or oh, my goodness (excl.)
far, far away, quite a distance
s/he is gored by a bull
